intro: Prenanthes chinensis, commonly known as Chinese water hemp, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Prenanthes chinensis is used in traditional Chinese medicine for its purported health benefits.
